channel.title: dotnet on Andri Rakotomalala
channel.description: Recent content in dotnet on Andri Rakotomalala

item.title: Things .NET can do that java can't
item.description: A few years ago, I left the java in favor of .net in my job. I started using java again recently for a project and it reminded me why java was so behind and counter-productive. Here is a list of what java does wrong (or does not do at all) that I now miss: Productive code Generics Yes I know, java has generics since 2004. But it’s commonly admitted that it’s a broken implementation.
